chapter.p: 101 Hear the word that Yahweh speaks to you, O house of Israel. 2Thus says Yahweh:

ul.li1: “You must not learn the way of the nations,
ul.li2: and you must not be dismayed by the signs of the heavens,
for the nations are dismayed by them.
ul.li1: 3For the statutes of the peoples are vanity,
ul.li2: for it is a tree cut down from the forest,
the work of the hands of a craftsman with the tool.
ul.li1: 4He decorates it with silver and gold,
ul.li2: they strengthen it with nails and hammers,
so that it does not stagger.
ul.li1: 5They are like scarecrowsHebrew “scarecrow” in a cucumber field,
ul.li2: they cannot speak.
ul.li1: Indeed, they must be carried,
ul.li2: for they cannot march.
ul.li1: You must not be afraid of them,
ul.li2: for they cannot do evil;
ul.li1: furthermore, to do good is not in them.”
6There is none like you, O Yahweh,
ul.li2: you are great and your name is great in might.
ul.li1: 7Who would not revere you, O king of the nations?
ul.li2: For you it is fitting.
ul.li1: For among all the wise men of the nations,
ul.li2: and in all their kingdoms,Hebrew “kingdom”
there is none like you.
ul.li1: 8At the same timeLiterally “And in one” they are stupid and foolish,
ul.li2: in the instruction of idols, it is wood.
ul.li1: 9Silver beaten from Tarshish is brought,
ul.li2: and gold from Uphaz,
ul.li1: the work of the craftsman and the hands of the goldsmith.
Blue and purple are their clothing,
ul.li2: all of them are the work of skillful people.
ul.li1: 10But Yahweh is the true God,
ul.li2: he is the living God,
and an everlasting king.Literally “a king of eternity”
ul.li1: Because of his wrath the earth quakes,
ul.li2: and the nations cannot endure his anger.

chapter.p: 11“ThusLiterally “Like this” you shall say to them,

ul.li1: ‘Gods who did not make the heavens and the earth
ul.li2: will perish from the earth and from under these heavens.
ul.li1: 12He is the maker of the earth by his power,
ul.li2: who created the world by his wisdom,
and by his understanding he stretched out heaven.
ul.li1: 13When he utters his voiceLiterally “At the voice of his giving” there is a noise of water in the heavens,
ul.li2: and he causes the mist to rise from the endsHebrew “end” of the earth.
ul.li1: He makes lightning for the rain,
ul.li2: and he causes the wind to go out from his storehouses.
ul.li1: 14EveryoneLiterally “All humankind” is stupid, without knowledge,Literally “from knowledge”
ul.li2: every goldsmith is ashamed by his divine image,
ul.li1: for his cast image is an illusion,
ul.li2: and there is no breath in them.
ul.li1: 15They are vanity, a work of mockery,
ul.li2: at the time of their punishment, they will perish.
ul.li1: 16The portion of Jacob is not like these,
ul.li2: for he is the creator of everything,
ul.li1: and Israel is the tribe of his inheritance,
ul.li2: Yahweh of hosts is his name.
ul.li1: 17Gather your bundle from the ground,
ul.li2: you who live under the siege.’ ”

ul.li1: “Look, I am about to sling out the inhabitants of the land at this time,
ul.li2: and I will bring distress to them, so that they may feel it.”

ul.li1: 19Woe to me, because of my wound.
ul.li2: My wound is incurable.
ul.li1: But I said, “Surely this is my sickness,
ul.li2: and I must bear it.”
ul.li1: 20My tent is devastated,
ul.li2: and all my tent cords are torn.
ul.li1: My children have gone out from me,
ul.li2: and they are not.
ul.li1: There is no one who pitches my tent again,
ul.li2: or one who puts up my tent curtains.
ul.li1: 21For the shepherds have become stupid,
ul.li2: they do not seek Yahweh.
ul.li1: ThereforeLiterally “Unto thus” they do not have insight,
ul.li2: and all of their flock are scattered.
ul.li1: 22Listen, news:Or “a report”
Look, it is coming,
ul.li2: a great roar from the land of the north,
ul.li1: to make the cities of Judah a desolation,
ul.li2: a lair of jackals.
ul.li1: 23I know, O Yahweh, that to the human is not his own way,
ul.li2: nor to a person is the walking and the directing of his own step.
ul.li1: 24ChastiseOr “Discipline” me, O Yahweh, but in moderation,
ul.li2: not in your anger, lest you eradicate me.
ul.li1: 25Pour out your wrath on the nations that do not know you,
ul.li2: and on the peoples that do not call on your name,
ul.li1: for they have devoured Jacob,
ul.li2: they have devoured and consumed him,
and they have caused his settlement to be desolate.
